messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Thermostat.LivingRoom.NuCore
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [RCT]
    Report Mode [RM]

USER QUERY:
How can I set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and turn the fan to high speed?

First, I identify the relevant properties and commands from the device structure. The Target Temperature property ranges from 10.0 to 30.0 °C, and the fan speed can be set to Low, Medium, or High. The accepted commands to change these are Set Target Temperature (STT) with a float parameter in °C, and Set Fan Speed (SFS) with an enum parameter.

To set the thermostat to 22 °C, use the STT command with parameter 22.0. To set the fan speed to high, use the SFS command with parameter High (which corresponds to [2]).

Result: Send STT(22.0) to set the temperature and SFS(2) to set the fan speed to high.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Light.Bedroom.CeilingLED
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    On Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Ramp Rate
      Enum
        9.0 minutes [0]
        6.0 minutes [3]
        1.0 minute [12]
        30.0 seconds [18]
        0.5 seconds [28]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Off [DOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    Ramp Rate [RR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          9.0 minutes [0]
          6.0 minutes [3]
          1.0 minute [12]
          30.0 seconds [18]
          0.5 seconds [28]
    On Level [OL]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the bedroom ceiling light to 75% brightness with a ramp rate of 1 minute?

I first review the device's properties and commands. The On Level property ranges from 0 to 100%, and the Ramp Rate property is an enum with values including 1.0 minute [12]. The accepted commands to set brightness and ramp rate are On Level (OL) with a percentage parameter and Ramp Rate (RR) with an enum parameter.

To set the brightness to 75%, send OL with parameter 75. To set the ramp rate to 1 minute, send RR with parameter 12.

Result: Execute OL(75) to set brightness and RR(12) to set ramp rate to 1 minute.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: HVAC.GarageVent.NuCore
  ***Properties***
    Vent Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Fan Speed
      Range 0 to 3 Unit Level
    Temperature
      Range -10 to 50 Unit °C
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Vent [OV]
    Close Vent [CV]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 3 Unit Level
    Set Temperature [ST]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range -10 to 50 Unit °C
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Vent Status [RVS]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Please open the garage vent and set the fan speed to level 2.

I analyze the device structure: the vent status can be Open or Closed, controlled by Open Vent (OV) and Close Vent (CV) commands. Fan speed ranges from 0 to 3 levels, set by Set Fan Speed (SFS) command with a parameter in that range.

To open the vent, send the OV command. To set fan speed to level 2, send SFS with parameter 2.

Result: Send OV to open the vent and SFS(2) to set fan speed to level 2.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Light.Porch.NuCoreLED
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    On Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Ramp Rate
      Enum
        9.0 minutes [0]
        5.0 minutes [4]
        2.0 seconds [27]
        0.1 seconds [31]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Off [DOF]
    Fast On [DFON]
    Fast Off [DFOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    Ramp Rate [RR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          9.0 minutes [0]
          5.0 minutes [4]
          2.0 seconds [27]
          0.1 seconds [31]
    On Level [OL]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the porch light to 60% brightness with the fastest ramp rate available.

Reviewing the device structure, the On Level property accepts values from 0 to 100%. The Ramp Rate property is an enum with options including 0.1 seconds [31], which is the fastest ramp rate listed.

To turn on the porch light to 60%, send the On Level (OL) command with parameter 60. To set the fastest ramp rate, send Ramp Rate (RR) with parameter 31.

Result: Send OL(60) to set brightness and RR(31) to set the ramp rate to 0.1 seconds.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Thermostat.Bedroom.NuCore
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 0 to 40 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 15 to 28 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Humidity
      Range 20 to 80 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 15 to 28 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Humidity [SH]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 20 to 80 Unit %
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [RCT]
    Report Humidity [RH]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the bedroom thermostat to auto mode and target temperature to 24 degrees Celsius.

From the device structure, the Mode property supports an enum with Auto as [3]. The Target Temperature accepts values from 15 to 28 °C. The commands to set these are Set Mode (SM) and Set Target Temperature (STT).

To set the thermostat to auto mode, send SM with parameter 3. To set the target temperature to 24 °C, send STT with parameter 24.

Result: Send SM(3) to set mode to auto and STT(24) to set target temperature to 24 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Light.Hallway.NuCoreLED
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    On Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Ramp Rate
      Enum
        9.0 minutes [0]
        4.0 minutes [6]
        3.0 minutes [8]
        0.5 seconds [28]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Off [DOF]
    Fast On [DFON]
    Fast Off [DFOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    Ramp Rate [RR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          9.0 minutes [0]
          4.0 minutes [6]
          3.0 minutes [8]
          0.5 seconds [28]
    On Level [OL]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you brighten the hallway light gradually with a ramp rate of 3 minutes?

The device supports a Ramp Rate property with an enum including 3.0 minutes [8]. The Brighten command (BRT) is accepted to increase brightness gradually. To achieve a gradual brighten with a 3-minute ramp rate, first set the ramp rate to 3 minutes using RR with parameter 8, then send the Brighten command.

Result: Send RR(8) to set ramp rate to 3 minutes, then send BRT to brighten gradually.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: HVAC.Basement.Fan
  ***Properties***
    Fan Speed
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RS]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the basement fan and set its speed to 4.

The device has a Status property with Off and On states, and a Fan Speed property ranging from 0 to 5. The accepted commands include Turn On (TON) and Set Fan Speed (SFS) with a parameter from 0 to 5.

To turn on the fan, send TON. To set the fan speed to 4, send SFS with parameter 4.

Result: Send TON to turn on the fan and SFS(4) to set fan speed to 4.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Light.Garage.NuCoreLED
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    On Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Ramp Rate
      Enum
        9.0 minutes [0]
        7.0 minutes [2]
        1.5 minutes [11]
        0.2 seconds [30]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Off [DOF]
    Fast On [DFON]
    Fast Off [DFOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    Ramp Rate [RR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          9.0 minutes [0]
          7.0 minutes [2]
          1.5 minutes [11]
          0.2 seconds [30]
    On Level [OL]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
I want to quickly turn off the garage light and then set it to 40% brightness.

The device supports Fast Off (DFOF) command to quickly turn off the light. To set brightness, the On Level (OL) command accepts a parameter from 0 to 100%.

First, send the Fast Off command to turn off the light quickly. Then send OL with parameter 40 to set brightness to 40%.

Result: Send DFOF to quickly turn off the garage light, then OL(40) to set brightness to 40%.
